verse: बिभर्षि रूपाण्यवबोध आत्माक्षेमाय लोकस्य चराचरस्य । सत्त्वोपपन्नानि सुखावहानिसतामभद्राणि मुहुः खलानाम् ॥

terms.rūpāṇi: varieties of forms, such as Matsya, Kūrma, Varāha, Rāma and Nṛsiṁha
terms.avabodhaḥ ātmā: in spite of having different incarnations, You remain the Supreme, full of knowledge
terms.kṣemāya: for the benefit of everyone, and especially the devotees

vedabase.translation: O Lord, You are always in full knowledge, and to bring all good fortune to all living entities, You appear in different incarnations, all of them transcendental to the material creation. When You appear in these incarnations, You are pleasing to the pious and religious devotees, but for nondevotees You are the annihilator.
vedabase.purport: This verse explains why the Supreme Personality of Godhead appears as an incarnation again and again. The incarnations of the Supreme Personality of Godhead all function differently, but their main purpose is paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṁ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām — to protect the devotees and annihilate the miscreants. Yet even though the duṣkṛtīs, or miscreants, are annihilated, this is ultimately good for them.

terms.आत्माक्षेमाय: for the welfare of the self
terms.सत्त्वोपपन्नानि: arising from the mode of goodness

gpt.meaning: You sustain the various forms and knowledge for the welfare of the self and the world, for both living and non living beings. The sources of happiness arising from the mode of goodness are repeatedly experienced by the virtuous, while the wicked face inauspicious things repeatedly.

bard.meaning: You bear forms, consciousness, self for the well-being of the world, moving and unmoving, born of nature, conducive to happiness of the good, harmful again and again of the wicked.
